intro: Zygia dinizii, commonly known as the Dinizii's zygia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from pink to red. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to habitat loss, Zygia dinizii is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
